title: Understanding Event-Driven Programming
text: Event-driven programming is a paradigm where the flow of the program is determined by events such as user actions, sensor outputs, or messages from other programs.

title: Identifying Events
text: Events can be anything from a mouse click, a key press, or a message from another program. These events trigger specific procedures in the program.

hintAnswer: procedures that are executed when specific actions are taken by the user or other events occur
title: Defining Event-Driven Procedures
choices: procedures that are executed when specific actions are taken by the user or other events occur
standard procedures executed with the processing of code
a set of procedures used for a variety of tasks
